results.title: Bantu tribes of Southern Africa
results.creator_credit: Willem Vilioen and Paul Hoefler Special Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the old ways of life among the Zulu, Xhosa, Swazi, Ndebele, Sotho and Venda tribes. These various Bantu groups are now being brought into the South African industrial community. Outlines the ways in which this movement is changing the culture of the tribes and the struggle to preserve some of the old ways.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Willem Vilioen and Paul Hoefler Special Productions

results.title: Ballet by Degas
results.creator_credit: J.H. Lenauer, George Jacobson and Mavis Lyons
results.brief_description: Studies of a number of the ballet paintings by Edgar Degas (1834-1917): “The Ballet Class”, “Coryphee Resting”, “Ballerina and the Lady with the Fan”, all from the Philadelphia Museum of Art, and “On Stage”, “Dancers Practising at the Bar”, and “Pink and Green” from the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

results.brief_description: This series offers instructional assistance from swimmers Mark Tonelli and Drew Mayhew in a number of strokes.

results.title: Swimming
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Swimming with Mark Tonelli”.
Approved by the Department of Education, this video is designed for swimming instruction. Mark Tonelli and Duncan Goodhew, both Olympic gold medallists, give instruction on freestyle, breaststroke, backstroke, butterfly and the mechanics of swimming. Each stroke is treated as a separate entity. Teacher’s notes are also available.

results.title: Depression. Addiction
results.creator_credit: Michael Custance, Annie Moore, B-line Productions and Discovery Networks Europe
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Alternative”.
This episode of the fifteen part television series on complementary health focuses on two separate segments: “Depression” (and stress) and “Addiction”. In the first segment on depression, a brief definition and explanation of how and why this emotional illness can cause so much grief, physically and psychically. Explains ‘Melancholic’ and ‘Atypical’ depression and the fact that stress can also be attributed and/or linked to depression. Suggests that learning a better response to depression rather than just trying to cure it would be far more beneficial. By using case studies, the following areas of therapy are discussed and demonstrated: Hypnotherapy; Colour therapy; Reflexology and flower remedy therapy; the Journey therapy. The second segment deals with various forms of addiction with a brief explanation of why some people suffer from this disease (10% of the population have addictive or compulsive behavior problems) and why others don’t. Through various case studies, it covers cannabis, food and alcohol addiction with discussion and demonstration of the following therapies: Homeopathic and Shamanic practice; Hypnotherapy and nutrition; Chinese medicine including acupuncture, Qi Gong and herbal therapy. Commentary by Dilly Barlow.

results.title: Back pain. Migraine
results.creator_credit: Serena Macbeth, Annie Moore, B-line Productions and Discovery Networks Europe
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Alternative”.
This episode of the fifteen part television series on complementary health focuses on two separate segments: “Back pain” and “Migraine”. Dealing with back pain first, it is said that two-thirds of the population in the United Kingdom suffers from this physical ailment and that it is the second most common problem after heart disease. Back pain is usually caused through spinal disorders from accidents, sport injuries and work related physical stress. Treatment can be obtained from a range of practitioners including Osteopaths, Chiropractors, Physiotherapists and non-surgical medical practitioners. Using case studies, the following areas of therapy are discussed and demonstrated: Alexander technique/swimming; Osteopathy; Bowen technique; Electro-crystal therapy; Pilates. The second segment covers migraines which can be triggered off through various reasons including over exertion or stress causing tightness in the muscles. 60% of migraines are caused by displaced vertebrates in the cervical spine and can consist of many different symptoms, including headache, nausea, aversion to light and sound, vomiting, tiredness, It usually affects half the head and can sometimes create a sensititvity to alcohol, citrus, cheese, chocolate and other food types. The following areas of therapy are discussed and demonstrated: Magnet therapy; Osteopathy; 5-Element acupuncture; integrated treatment including therapeutic yoga, relaxation, breathing exercises, specific neck and spine exercises. Commentary by Dilly Barlow.

results.title: Bach flower remedies: a further understanding
results.brief_description: The Bach Flower Remedies represent a system of healing for the personality and temperament. Their purpose is to help to re-establish emotional equilibrium and thus act as an aid to one’s own natural healing. This interesting and informative video gives a general guide to Dr Edward Bach’s flower remedies. Bach believed that the real cause of an illness was the mental state or temperament of the patient and not the condition of their body. Using flowers from plants and trees, Bach had, by the time of his death, discovered 38 remedies which he divided into seven groups: fear; uncertainty; insufficient interest in present circumstances; loneliness; over-sensitivity to influence and ideas; despondency or despair; over care for the welfare of others. Filmed at Mount Vernon, the cottage in Oxfordshire where Dr Edward Bach spent the last years of his life, Brenda Longman (presenter and narrator) discusses various aspects of the remedies with John Ramsell and Judy Howard (trustees and curators of Mount Vernon) including a demonstration in making up the remedies, the process of determining the right remedy for a particular type of person, self-help advice and examples of remedies for depression and anger. A recommended reading list is provided at the end of the program.

results.title: Baby care: feeding
results.creator_credit: Paul H Seilzinger, Irving C. Boerlin and Pennsylvania State College Productions
results.brief_description: The steps necessary when prepapring to feed an infant are dealt with in detail, with stress on the importance of cleanliness and exactness. (Deals mainly with artificial feeding).
